Content:: 17, see text Acipenser is a genus of sturgeons. With 17 living species (others are only known from fossil remains), it is the largest genus in the order Acipenseriformes. They are native to freshwater and estuarine systems of Eurasia and North America, and most species are threatened.[2] Several species also known to enter near-shore marine environments in the Atlantic, Arctic and Pacific oceans. There are 17 living species:[2] There are 10 species known from fossil remains:[3]   This order Acipenseriformes (Sturgeon and Paddlefish) related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
